name: OmniNav (Fourth Year Design Project)
description: Designed and built a navigation belt for the visually impaired using an Arduino. Developed an Android app in Java using Google Map’s API to provide directions to the belt by a touch screen and voice command interface.

name: Photography Blog
description: Designed and developed a web application for photography blogs using AngularJS

name: Emaily (Hack Princeton)
description:
Built a Facebook chatbot using Microsoft’s AI Luis to remind a user of the emails they have read but not responded to in the last 24 hours and offers choices to ignore or set reminders.
Technologies used: Node.js, Heroku, MongoDB, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Microsoft’s AI Luis

name: Real-time Kernel
description: Developed a small real-time kernel for ARM Cortex-M3 Processor. Supports task creation, multithreading, I/O (GPIO and peripherals), and system console on KEIL MCB1700 evaluation board. Manages memory using half-fit allocation algorithm with fixed memory blocks.
